intro: Hieracium blancii, commonly known as the white hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and bloom from late spring to early summer. Hieracium blancii is often found in open habitats and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
